ProductExport.Name: August Smart Lock Rev 3
ProductExport.Description: Give your customer total control over their front door, from anywhere. The August Smart Lock Pro is the leading Z-Wave Plus retrofit smart lock. You can lock and unlock your door, create virtual keys for guests, and keep track of who comes and goes with a 24/7 activity log, all from your iOS or Android smartphone. The August Smart Lock Pro features Z-Wave Plus and BLE and it is the only lock to support the three leading voice-assistants, Siri, Google Assistant, and Amazon Alexa. The lock quickly installs on the inside of your door with just a screwdriver. Keep your exterior door hardware exactly as it is and use your traditional key any time.
ProductExport.Description_Short: Control and monitor your door from anywhere the August Smart Lock Pro. Lock and unlock your door and always know who's coming and goingâ€“ all from your phone.
ProductExport.InclusionDescription: In order to include the August Smart Lock on to a Z-Wave network the user will have to do the following: 1. Open the August app 2. Go to the Lock Settings screen 3. Select Z-Wave Settings 4. Select Add To A Z-Wave Network 5. Put the controller into inclusion mode and select My Hub is in Inclusion Mode on the August app
ProductExport.ExclusionDescription: In order to exclude the August Smart Lock from a Z-Wave network the user will have to do the following: 1. Open the August app 2. Go to the Lock Settings screen 3. Select Z-Wave Settings 4. Select Remove Z-Wave Device 5. Put the controller into exclusion mode and select My Hub is in Exlusion Mode on the August app
ProductExport.ResetDescription: In order to reset the August Smart Lock the user will have to do the following: 1. Open the August app 2. Go to the Lock Settings screen 3. Select Z-Wave Settings 4. Select Remove Z-Wave device 5. Select My Hub Is No Longer Working 6. Caution: Resetting a Z-Wave device without telling the hub can cause performance issues. Use this procedure only when the Z-Wave hub is missing or otherwise inoperable. 7. Select Reset Z-Wave Device 8. On the Reset Z-Wave Device? prompt select Reset
ProductExport.WakeupDescription: Any operation (manual, RF, etc.) will wake up the lock.

AssociationGroupExport.Description: The Lifeline group on this lock is used to report battery status, door lock operation status, and device reset locally notifications to nodes on the group list.
The Doorlock Op group on this lock is used to report door lock operation status to nodes on the group list.

FeatureExport.featureDescription: Enter the type (e.g. AA, CR2032, AAA) of the battery/batteries that the product uses.
If the product is only available in one color, pick the color from the list.
FeatureExport.featurePrompt: Choose one color for the product's main color component. Not for use with products available in multiple colors.

FeatureExport.featureDescription: Connectivity for communications with a host control computer or system.
FeatureExport.featurePrompt: Use CTRL to select more than one.

FeatureExport.featureDescription: Describes the general type of door lock.
Indicates whether the firmware can be updated and whether it is done by the consumer or a technician.
Enter the number of batteries of the designated type that the product uses.
FeatureExport.featurePrompt: Enter a number only for the number of batteries.

FeatureExport.featureDescription: Select the Notification Types that the product handles (controllers), or sends (slaves).
FeatureExport.featurePrompt: Use the CTRL key to select more than one.
